item.title: Mod delete this thread! please
item.dc:creator: @weeddamn weeddamn
item.description:
@weeddamn wrote:

I can help you but its only for a temp fix although it works, you would have to apply this each time you wanted to stop a nuller from crashing

Add This in Server.java…this should be easy to declare…

if (connectingHost.equalsIgnoreCase("IPHERE")) { s.close(); }

And you should also add 1 connection per ip

Add the top two classes to your folder.

In server.java:

below the static variables at the top, add this:

private final ConnectedList list = ConnectedList.getInstance();

Under:

misc.println("Connection accepted from " + connectingHost + ": " + s.getPort() + ".");
Add this:

if(!list.contains(connectingHost))    {
    playerHandler.newPlayerClient(s, connectingHost);
    list.add(connectingHost);
} else {
    System.err.println(connectingHost+" already connected!");
    s.close();
}

Now in Client.java:

Under:

public class client extends Player implements Runnable {

add this:

In the method: public void destruct()
right above: super.destruct()

add this:

list.remove(connectedFrom);

And You need to save this file as ConnectedList.java:

[code]
import java.util.Vector;
import java.util.List;
public final class ConnectedList {

private static ConnectedList instance;
private List<String> list = new Vector<String>(500);

public static ConnectedList getInstance()	{
	if(instance == null)
		instance = new ConnectedList();
	return instance;
}

public void add(final String s)	{
	list.add(s);
}

public void remove(final String s)	{
	if(contains(s))
		list.remove(s);
}

public boolean contains(final String s)	{
	return list.contains(s);
}

}[/code]
